categoryRubrics.rule: Generally, the identifiers found within a CDA document should be unique and non-reoccurring within the same document.
Patient DOB should be valid and properly precisioned
Patient's Alternative Name Rule

issuesList.xmlString:
<name xmlns:xsi="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema-instance" use="L">
          <given>Alice</given>
          <given>Jones</given>
          <given qualifier="BR">Alicia</given>
          <family qualifier="SP">Newman</family>
          <suffix nullFlavor="UNK"/>
        </name>

categoryRubrics.description: Patient's alternative names such as birth name, previous name should exist in its own name element independent of the legal name

categoryRubrics.rule: EffectiveDate/Time elements have the right time and timezone offsets
categoryRubrics.description: EffectiveTime elements in the section are expected to have timeoffsets along with the date and are typically nonzero timeoffsets. In addition they are expected to have the timezone information for proper interpretation.For e.g if the time is being defaulted to 000000 for hours, minutes and seconds for multiple entries it might be worth checking if the data was entered properly. Also if the time offsets are present without a timezone, the time may be interpreted incorrectly, hence timezones should be specified as part of the time element.

categoryRubrics.rule: EffectiveDate/Times for all historical activities should be within the lifespan on the patient
The Display Names used by the structured data should match the Display Name (Preferred Name) within the Terminology

categoryRubrics.description: Each of the code systems, value sets specified by the C-CDA IG refers back to standard terminologies like SNOMED-CT, LOINC, RxNorm, ICD9, ICD10. When codes from these codesystems are used to represent structured data the display name corresponding to the code should be used as part of the document

categoryRubrics.rule: Allergies Concern observation effective times reflect the appropriate allergy concern status
categoryRubrics.description: An Allergy Concern of completed or suspended should have an allergy observation effectiveTime/high value present.Similarly an allergy Concern which is Active shall not have an Allergy observation effectiveTime/high value.

categoryRubrics.rule: Each entry has to be linked to related narrative text
categoryRubrics.description: Each entry has to be linked to related narrative text

EffectiveDate/Time elements have the right time and timezone offsets

categoryRubrics.description: EffectiveTime elements in the section are expected to have timeoffsets along with the date and are typically nonzero timeoffsets. In addition they are expected to have the timezone information for proper interpretation.For e.g if the time is being defaulted to 000000 for hours, minutes and seconds for multiple entries it might be worth checking if the data was entered properly. Also if the time offsets are present without a timezone, the time may be interpreted incorrectly, hence timezones should be specified as part of the time element.

The Display Names used by the structured data should match the Display Name (Preferred Name) within the Terminology

                  <id assigningAuthorityName="FDA" extension="(01)00643169007222(17)160128(21)BLC200461H" root="2.16.840.1.113883.3.3719"/>
                  <playingDevice>
                    <code code="704708004" codeSystem="2.16.840.1.113883.6.96" codeSystemName="SNOMED CT" displayName="Cardiac resynchronization therapy implantable pacemaker"/>
                  </playingDevice>
                  <scopingEntity>
                    <id root="2.16.840.1.113883.3.3719"/>
                  </scopingEntity>
                </participantRole>
              </participant>
            </procedure>

categoryRubrics.description: Each entry has to be linked to related narrative text

categoryRubrics.rule: All Template Ids should be Valid with correct extension value
EffectiveDate/Time elements have the right time and timezone offsets

issuesList.xmlString: <effectiveTime xmlns:xsi="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema-instance" value="201506221130"/>

categoryRubrics.description: EffectiveTime elements in the section are expected to have timeoffsets along with the date and are typically nonzero timeoffsets. In addition they are expected to have the timezone information for proper interpretation.For e.g if the time is being defaulted to 000000 for hours, minutes and seconds for multiple entries it might be worth checking if the data was entered properly. Also if the time offsets are present without a timezone, the time may be interpreted incorrectly, hence timezones should be specified as part of the time element.

categoryRubrics.rule: EffectiveDate/Times for all historical activities should be within the lifespan on the patient

issuesList.xmlString: <effectiveTime xmlns:xsi="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema-instance" value="201506221130"/>

categoryRubrics.description: EffectiveDate/Times for historical events should be greater than the patient's date of birth and less than the earliest of current time or patient's date of death.

categoryRubrics.rule: The Display Names used by the structured data should match the Display Name (Preferred Name) within the Terminology
Smoking status code value should be valid
Smoking status observation Template Id should be valid
Systems should capture birth sex independent of the Administrative Gender and encode them as an observation in the Social History Section

issuesList.xmlString:
SOCIAL HISTORY
Social History Observation Description Dates Observed
Smoking Status Heavy tobacco smoker, ??-??/day May 1, 2005 - February 27, 2011
Smoking Status Current every day smoker February 27, 2011
Current Smoking Status Current every day June 22, 2015

categoryRubrics.description: Systems should capture birth sex independent of the Administrative Gender and encode them as an observation in the Social History Section.

categoryRubrics.rule: Each entry has to be linked to related narrative text

issuesList.xmlString: <code xmlns:xsi="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema-instance" code="8302-2" codeSystem="2.16.840.1.113883.6.1" codeSystemName="LOINC" displayName="Height"/>
<code xmlns:xsi="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema-instance" code="8462-4" codeSystem="2.16.840.1.113883.6.1" codeSystemName="LOINC" displayName="BP Diastolic"/>
<code xmlns:xsi="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema-instance" code="59408-5" codeSystem="2.16.840.1.113883.6.1" codeSystemName="LOINC" displayName="O2 % BldC Oximetry"/>

categoryRubrics.description: Each of the code systems, value sets specified by the C-CDA IG refers back to standard terminologies like SNOMED-CT, LOINC, RxNorm, ICD9, ICD10. When codes from these codesystems are used to represent structured data the display name corresponding to the code should be used as part of the document

categoryRubrics.rule: The Vital Sign Observation entries should use LOINC codes to represent the type of vital sign being captured
Each of the Vital Sign Observations should use the recommended UCUM units to represent the vital sign measurement result
The EffectiveDate/Time elements for the Vital Sign Organizer must encompass the underlying observations
Each entry has to be linked to related narrative text

categoryRubrics.description: Each entry has to be linked to related narrative text

categoryRubrics.rule: All Template Ids should be Valid with correct extension value

referenceErrors.description: A compatible R1.1 templateId without an extension must be included in addition to the existing R2.1 templateId with an extension for Result Observation (V3) 2.16.840.1.113883.10.20.22.4.2:2015-08-01. When asserting this templateId, all C-CDA R2.1 document, section, and entry templates that had a previous version in C-CDA R1.1 SHALL include both the C-CDA R2.1 templateId and the C-CDA R1.1 templateId root without an extension. See C-CDA R2.1 Volume 1 - Design Considerations for additional detail (CONF:1198-32936, CONF:1198-32934, DSTU:757, DSTU:781).

The node '@unit' does not exist at the expected path /ClinicalDocument[1]/component[1]/structuredBody[1]/component[9]/section[1]/entry[2]/organizer[1]/component[3]/observation[1]/value[1] but is required as per the specification: If Observation/value is a physical quantity (xsi:type="PQ"), the unit of measure SHALL be selected from ValueSet UnitsOfMeasureCaseSensitive 2.16.840.1.113883.1.11.12839 DYNAMIC (CONF:1198-31484).
referenceErrors.type: ONC 2015 S&CC Vocabulary Validation Conformance Error
